Package org.apache.wayang.core.plan.executionplan

Class Channel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wayang.core.plan.executionplan.Channel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BroadcastChannel, CollectionChannel, DataSetChannel, FileChannel, RddChannel, SqlQueryChannel, StreamChannel, TensorChannel
    public abstract class Channel
extends java.lang.Object
    Models the data movement between to ExecutionTasks.

      • Channel

        protected Channel​(Channel original)
        Creates a new, hierarchical instance. Mimes the original's properties except for the consumers.
        Parameters:
        original - the original instance whose properties will be mimed

    • Method Detail

      • addConsumer

        public void addConsumer​(ExecutionTask consumer,
                        int inputIndex)
        Set up a consumer ExecutionTask for this instance.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the new consumer
        inputIndex - the input index for this instance into the consumer

      • isReusable

        public boolean isReusable()
        Declares whether this is not a read-once instance.
        Returns:
        whether this instance can have multiple consumers

      • isSuitableForBreakpoint

        public boolean isSuitableForBreakpoint()
        Tells whether this instance lends itself for Breakpoints. That is particularly the case if:
        1. it is produced immediately by its producer (getProducer();
        2. the contained data are at rest;
        3. and, as a bonus, the cardinality of the data can be observed.
        Returns:
        whether this instance lends itself for Breakpoints

      • isExecutionBreaker

        public boolean isExecutionBreaker()
        Tells whether this instance connects different PlatformExecutions. The answer is not necessarily only determined by whether this instance connects ExecutionTasks of different Platforms.
        Returns:
        whether this instance connects different PlatformExecutions

        public ExecutionTask getProducer()

      • withSiblings

        public java.util.stream.Stream<Channel> withSiblings()
        Creates a Stream of this instance and its siblings. The sibling relationship must not be altered while processing the Stream.
        Returns:
        the Stream

      • getCorrespondingSlots

        public java.util.Collection<Slot<?>> getCorrespondingSlots()
        Returns:
        all InputSlots and OutputSlots that are represented by this instance and its siblings

      • retain

        public boolean retain​(java.util.Set<ExecutionStage> retainableStages)
        Scrap any consumer ExecutionTasks and sibling Channels that are not within the given ExecutionStages.
        Returns:
        whether consumer ExecutionTasks have been removed

      • copy

        public abstract Channel copy()
        Create a copy of this instance. Mimics everything apart from the consumers. Also delimits already executed ExecutionTasks and those that are not executed yet. Be careful when revising this invariant.

      • getOriginal

        public Channel getOriginal()
        Returns:
        if this is not a copy, then this instance, otherwise the root original instance

      • isCopy

        public boolean isCopy()
        Tells whether this instance is a copy. If so, it delimits already executed ExecutionTasks and those that are not executed yet. Be careful when revising this invariant.
        See Also:
        copy(), getOriginal()

      • mergeIntoOriginal

        public void mergeIntoOriginal()
        Merges this instance into the original instance (getOriginal().

        The consumers of the original instance are cleared and replaced with the consumers of this instance. For all other properties, the original and this instance should agree.

      • getDataSetType

        public DataSetType<?> getDataSetType()
        Returns:
        the DataSetType of this instance (requires a producer)
        See Also:
        setProducer(ExecutionTask)

      • getDescriptor

        public ChannelDescriptor getDescriptor()

      • getProducerSlot

        public OutputSlot<?> getProducerSlot()

      • getProducerOperator

        public ExecutionOperator getProducerOperator()
        Try to obtain the ExecutionOperator producing this instance, either from a given OutputSlot or a ExecutionTask that was specified as producer.
        Returns:
        the ExecutionOperator or null if none is set up

      • getSiblings

        public java.util.Set<Channel> getSiblings()

      • createInstance

        public abstract ChannelInstance createInstance​(Executor executor,
                                               OptimizationContext.OperatorContext producerOperatorContext,
                                               int producerOutputIndex)
        Create a ChannelInstance for this instance.
        Parameters:
        executor - that manages the resource or null if none

      • isBetweenStages

        public boolean isBetweenStages()
        Tests for inter-stage instances.
        Returns:
        whether this instance connects ExecutionTasks of different ExecutionStages.
